Package ohos.multimodalinput.event

Class ManipulationEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.multimodalinput.event.MultimodalEvent
      • ohos.multimodalinput.event.ManipulationEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StylusEvent, TouchEvent

    public abstract class ManipulationEvent
extends MultimodalEvent
    Reports manipulation events.

    ManipulationEvent defines and abstracts all manipulation events, such as finger touch events. Such an event carries information including the event location and phase. Generally, the events are used as the input of the callback to capture and process the events. The callback divides an action into three phases: start, operating, and end. For example, for one finger touch, start means that a finger touches the screen, operating means that the finger moves on the screen, and end means that the finger lifts up from the screen.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    MultimodalEvent, MmiPoint
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.MultimodalInput#MULTIMODAL_INPUT

      • getStartTime

        public abstract long getStartTime​()
        Obtains the time (in ms) of the operation start phase.
        Returns:
        Returns the time (in ms) of the operation start phase.
        Since:
        1

      • getPhase

        public abstract int getPhase​()
        Obtains the operation phase of the event.

        The operation phase can be PHASE_NONE, PHASE_START, PHASE_MOVE, PHASE_COMPLETED, or PHASE_CANCEL.

        Returns:
        Returns the operation phase of the event. The return value can be PHASE_NONE, PHASE_START, PHASE_MOVE, PHASE_COMPLETED, or PHASE_CANCEL.
        Since:
        1

      • getPointerPosition

        public abstract MmiPoint getPointerPosition​(int index)
        Obtains the x and y coordinates of a pointer index relative to the offset position during touch control or trajectory tracking in an event.
        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the pointer index mapping to the pointer action in the event. The value ranges from 0 to getPointerCount()-1. For the mouse and stylus, only a single pointer action is supported. When the location information is obtained, the pointer index is set to 0.
        Returns:
        Returns the x and y coordinates of the pointer index. If a control's position has been specified, the x and y coordinates relative to the control are returned. If a control's position has not been specified, the x and y coordinates relative to the screen are returned.
        Since:
        1

      • setScreenOffset

        public abstract void setScreenOffset​(float offsetX,
                                     float offsetY)
        Sets the offset position relative to the screen.
        Parameters:
        offsetX - Indicates the offset relative to the x on the upper left corner of the screen.
        offsetY - Indicates the offset relative to the y on the upper left corner of the screen.
        Since:
        1

      • getPointerScreenPosition

        public abstract MmiPoint getPointerScreenPosition​(int index)
        Obtains the x and y coordinates of a pointer index relative to the screen coordinate origin during touch control or trajectory tracking in an event.
        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the pointer index mapping to the pointer ID in the event. The value ranges from 0 to getPointerCount()-1. For the mouse and stylus, only a single pointer action is supported. When the pointer ID is obtained, the pointer index is set to 0.
        Returns:
        Returns the x and y coordinates of the pointer index relative to the screen.
        Since:
        1

      • getPointerCount

        public abstract int getPointerCount​()
        Obtains the number of pointers for touch control or trajectory tracking in an event.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of pointers for touch control or trajectory tracking in an event.
        Since:
        1

      • getPointerId

        public abstract int getPointerId​(int index)
        Obtains the unique ID of a pointer in an event.
        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the pointer index mapping to the pointer ID in the event. The value ranges from 0 to getPointerCount()-1. For the mouse and stylus, only a single pointer action is supported. When the pointer ID is obtained, the pointer index is set to 0.
        Returns:
        Returns the unique ID of the pointer in the event.
        Since:
        1

      • getForce

        public abstract float getForce​(int index)
        Obtains the touch pressure of the finger with a specified index.

        The touch pressure of a finger generally ranges from 0 to 1.0. Depending on the calibration of the input device, a value greater than 1 may be generated sometimes.

        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the index of the touch finger. The value ranges from 0 to getPointerCount()-1. The position of the touch finger in the current event can be obtained based on its unique ID. For the mouse and stylus action events, only a single pointer action is supported. When the pressure information is obtained, the index is set to 0. For the mouse action event, the touch pressure is 1.0 when the left button is pressed and is 0 in other cases.
        Returns:
        Returns the touch pressure.
        Since:
        1

      • getRadius

        public abstract float getRadius​(int index)
        Obtains the touch radius of the finger with a specified index.

        The touch radius indicates the area the finger touches on the screen.

        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the index of the touch finger. The value ranges from 0 to getPointerCount()-1. The position of the touch finger in the current event can be obtained based on its unique ID. For the mouse and stylus action events, only a single pointer action is supported. When the screen size is obtained, the index is set to 0. For the mouse action event, the touch radius has a fixed value of 0.
        Returns:
        Returns the touch radius of the finger with a specified index.
        Since:
        1
